content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Two measures of a melody in four-four, with two flats in the key signature. The melody is eighth notes G4, A4, E-natural4, F4, G4, A4, quarter note F4, half note G4, half note rest.
Two measures of a melody in four-four, two flats in the key signature. The melody is eighth notes G4, A4, E-natural4, F-sharp4, G4, A4, quarter note F-sharp4, half note G4, half note rest.
Two measures of a melody in four-four, two flats in the key signature. The melody is eighth notes G4, A4, E-flat4, F4, G4, A4, quarter note F-sharp4, half note G4, half note rest.
Two measures of a melody in four-four, two flats in the key signature. The melody is eighth notes G4, A4, E-flat4, F4, G4, A4, quarter F4, half note G4, half note rest.

content.answer: Two measures of a melody in four-four, two flats in the key signature. The melody is eighth notes G4, A4, E-natural4, F-sharp4, G4, A4, quarter note F-sharp4, half note G4, half note rest.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
